intro: Lindernia chrysoplectra, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its delicate, showy inflorescences that resemble misty clouds. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, arranged in dense clusters. Lindernia chrysoplectra thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
